alert.note: Alert for Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 10 at 1:14PM EST until March 11 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with up to 4 inches along the western facing slopes from Backbone Ridge to the west. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph could result in areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...Garrett County. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM EST Saturday. Rain will change to snow between 5 PM and 7 PM. Snow will continue through tonight before tapering off toward Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
